meanings.sent1: The smell of rotten eggs was repugnant to her sensitive nose.
meanings.sent2: The spoiled milk had a repugnant odor that made everyone gag.
meanings.sent3: The idea of eating a sandwich filled with worms was so repugnant that it made her laugh.
meanings.sent4: The repugnant behavior of the bullies left a sour taste in everyone's mouth.
meanings.sent5: The repugnant sight of the overflowing garbage cans was hard to ignore.

meanings.sent1: Her cheerful demeanor was repugnant to his gloomy outlook on life.
meanings.sent2: The bright colors of the painting seemed repugnant against the dark background.
meanings.sent3: The cat found the idea of taking a bath repugnant and ran away in protest.
meanings.sent4: The loud music was repugnant to the peaceful atmosphere of the library.
meanings.sent5: The politician's words were so repugnant to the truth that no one believed him.
